Posts.Content: karen4u wrote: Hello all, I wanted to see if anyone had experienced any breakthrough bleeding following being chemically induced into menopause.  This is the first I have had in 5 years.  I am waiting on a call from my onc right now but wanted to see if this is something that is common to anyone else.  Thanks for all your input on this. Karen For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind. 2 Tim 1:7 12/2007 Stage IV: Mets to Liver Dx 6/2004, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/9 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Breakthrough bleeding after menopause karen4u lovinmomma

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2009 07:05PM karen4u wrote: I wanted to let you know where I am at with this.  Onc did refer me to my gyn and had appt with him today.  He did find a mass on my left ovary and sent me on to have a transvaginal ultasound done along with blood work.  Should get results from these possibly tomorrow.  Will update with results.  Karen
Posts.Title: Breakthrough bleeding after menopause karen4u lovinmomma

Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2009 09:03PM karen4u wrote: Wow, what a week.  Well first...good news... the ultrasound did not show a mass on the left ovary.  My gyn did a second pelvic exam last Thurs to recheck and didn't find the mass either.  He thinks it may have been feces in my colon especially since I have problems with constipation.  He was scheduled to do an endometrial biopsy on that day but since the procedure may  cause your heart rate to drop he decided not to b/c I had just been released from ICU at 830am that morning because of an episode of atrial fibrillation.  Geez, when it rains it pours.  On Wed at 1 pm I went to the ER and after unsuccessful attempts to convert my heart rhythm and rate I was admitted to ICU where it finally converted at 630 am Thurs.  My pap results were "not good" so the nurse told me.  No prob with the cervical cells but strangely enough endometrial cells showed up on the pap and blood work shows that I am still in menopause Well the biopsy was done today...OUCH,OUCH,OUCH...I was not expecting that.  Of course I'm  not sure what I was expecting I guess I just thought it would be something like a pap,Wrong!.. Anyway, I'll get the results next Mon.  All my scans are this Thurs so I'll let you know something as soon as I know it.  On a good note, I got my Yorkie, Bella last Thurs evening.  She is such a joy and great company.  She makes every step I do.  Till I know more...Karen
Posts.Title: Breakthrough bleeding after menopause karen4u lovinmomma

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2009 05:39PM karen4u wrote: Another crazy week.  Scans this past Thurs were all clear...Yahoooooo!!!  Onc decided to wait till after my cardiologist appt on 16th and my heart issues are resolved to start me back on Xeloda/Tykerb.  Did put me on Femara until then.  Endomet. bx was negative for atypia BUT did show proliferative pattern which occurs from receiving estrogen.  Interesting part is that my estradiol test he did was <3 which is postmenopausal.  Huh?????  The gyn just said oh well see ya next year.  Hmmmmm....I didn't like that answer so I made an appt with gyn onc in Little Rock and bottom line is he is doing a hysterectomy Fri at 11 am.  He was not pleased at all with the results of the tests and given my history and the importance of me not producing estrogen he felt this is the best option.  He also found a mass on my left ovary and as for it being malignant, he doesn't think it is but he wants it all out of there.   Suits me just fine.  So off to another surgery for me, last one I got a strand of pearls from DH, what shall I get for this one?  TaTa for now. Karen
Posts.Title: Breakthrough bleeding after menopause karen4u lovinmomma
